title: It's now almost impossible to work your way to riches, says report into growing wealth gap
description: The Resolution Foundation's analysis of the country's wealth gap comes seven weeks before the chancellor delivers what's expected to be a tax-raising budget, though the government seems reluctant to pursue wealth taxes.
content:
Britain's wealth gap is growing and it's now practically impossible for a typical worker to save enough to become rich, according to a report.
Analysis by The Resolution Foundation, a left-leaning thinktank, found it would take average earners 52 yea... [2825 chars]

title: Badenoch to set out new rule to cut borrowing and taxes
description: In a conference speech, the Tory leader will say the Conservatives are the only party "with a plan to get our economy back on track".
content:
The Conservatives will commit to a new economic "golden rule" designed to cut government borrowing and taxes, party leader Kemi Badenoch will say in her keynote speech to the party's conference.
The party says the rule would ensure half of all saving... [3759 chars]

title: UK won't relax visa rules for India, Starmer says
description: The PM says there are no plans to open up more visa routes ahead of a visit to India to tout a trade deal.
content:
Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK will not relax visa rules for India, speaking before he arrived in the country to tout the benefits of a recent trade agreement.
The prime minister is leading a delegation of more than 100 entrepreneurs, cultural lead... [1561 chars]

title: Scientists develop first-ever blood test to diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome
description: CFS is a disabling illness characterised by extreme fatigue that is not relieved by rest.
content:
A new blood test can diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome, also known as CFS or ME, with an accuracy of 96%, according to scientists who developed it.
The researchers, from the University of East Anglia, hope the breakthrough could pave the way for a si... [3043 chars]

title: High security a fact of life for UK's Jews living in fear of attack
description: Leaders in the UK's tight-knit Jewish population are asking what more can be done to keep their institutions safe.
